snippet: Lawmakers are expected to ask Mary T. Barra about contradictions between the findings of G.M.’s internal investigation and a congressional panel’s inquiry into the recall of millions of small cars.
abstract: General Motors chief executive Mary T Barra is expected to tell House panel that auto giant is determined to change its culture and prevent another safety crisis similar to its delay in recalling cars with defective switch; is likely to face skepticism from panel, who plan to ask her about contradictions between findings of GM's internal investigation and congressional committee's inquiry.

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD and BILL VLASIC

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers are expected to ask Mary T. Barra about contradictions between the findings of G.M.’s internal investigation and a congressional panel’s inquiry into the recall of millions of small cars.

headline.main: In G.M. Hearing, Lawmakers May Focus on Contradictions
headline.print_headline: In G.M. Hearing, Lawmakers May Focus on Contradictions
